It seems that the finer subtleties of good filmmaking present in Deliverance are lost on today's generation of moviegoers whose cinematic palates have been cloyed with multi-million-dollar special effects, unimaginative dialogue, mindless violence and saccharine plots.
To this day, I can't hear " Dueling Banjos " --or just about any banjo music for that matter--without thinking of this movie.
It is an excellent treatise of the human reaction when challenged with fear, danger and adventure.
spans: This is without a doubt one of the best movies I have ever seen; a chilling account of a doomed canoe trip that will haunt your memory for years to come.

responses: I think that The movie rushes along at a feverish pace, and particularly Gibson's and Glover's success working together on screen make this a timeless action film that is not to be missed.
The cross-cutting at the beginning of the film was particularly effective, in my opinion, as Martin Riggs ( Mel Gibson) and Roger Murtaugh ( Danny Glover) are introduced.
The fact that both Roger and Riggs hated that they had to work together was especially effective in creating a touching atmosphere as they grew to be closer and closer friends.

The final fight scene between Riggs and Mr. Joshua ( Busey) was a little excessive, and there were a few scenes which were a bit faulty ( how did the guy on the building ledge expect to kill himself when there was such a huge air bag inflated on the ground directly below him?), but overall this was a spectacular crime thriller.
spans: The movie rushes along at a feverish pace, and particularly Gibson's and Glover's success working together on screen make this a timeless action film that is not to be missed.
the cross-cutting at the beginning of the film was particularly effective , in my opinion , as martin riggs ( mel gibson ) and roger murtaugh ( danny glover ) are introduced .
the fact that both roger and riggs hated that they had to work together was especially effective in creating a touching atmosphere as they grew to be closer and closer friends .

the final fight scene between riggs and mr. joshua ( busey ) was a little excessive , and there were a few scenes which were a bit faulty ( how did the guy on the building ledge expect to kill himself when there was such a huge air bag inflated on the ground directly below him ? ) , but overall this was a spectacular crime thriller .
